author: Michelle Campos
title: 20.000 niños dejaron de ser atendidos por Cen-Cinái en últimos tres años
text:
Cerca de 20.000 niños dejaron de ser atendidos en los Centros de Educación y Nutrición y de Centros Infantiles de Atención Integral (Cen-Cinái) entre los años 2021 y 2023, según reveló una reciente auditoría realizada por la Contraloría General de la República.
Según el estudio, la población que acudía a los Cen-Cinái se redujo en un 37% durante el periodo analizado. Por ejemplo, los menores que recibían atención y cuido bajaron de 34.379 en 2021 a 25.524 en el 2023, mientras los beneficiarios del servicio de comidas diarias pasaron de 19.236 a 8.105 en ese plazo.
La tendencia a la disminución comenzó a verse en el 2022 y persistió el año siguiente. El informe del ente contralor señala que las estadísticas reflejan que la Dirección de Cen-Cinái atiende a menos población que antes de la pandemia provocada por la covid-19.
Dicho programa atiende a menores de edad de entre 0 y 13 años que viven en hogares en condición de vulnerabilidad, pobreza o pobreza extrema. Ellos son atendidos en los centros como parte del programa Intramuros, el cual se divide en el servicio de atención y protección infantil (API) y de alimentación a través de comidas servidas.
El servicio de API es brindado como una modalidad de cuido. Allí asisten pequeños en etapa escolar que requieren de atención y vigilancia porque, en muchos casos, sus padres deben salir a estudiar o trabajar. Las sedes de Cen-Cinái ofrecen este servicio en horarios diurnos, nocturnos y vespertinos.
Por su parte, el servicio de comidas servidas consiste en alimentos preparados en las instalaciones de los centros, los cuales se entregan diariamente en los establecimientos CINAI.
Dicho servicio está dirigido a niños menores de 13 años que viven en condiciones de pobreza básica, pobreza extrema o riesgo social. Adicionalmente, en algunos casos, se recibe a madres en periodo de lactancia para garantizar su adecuada alimentación y proteger el proceso de amamantamiento del bebé.
Según la auditoría, la capacidad de la Dirección Nacional de Cen-Cinái para entregar comidas también se redujo un 3,4% en el periodo analizado, aunque sigue sin operar al máximo de su capacidad. En 2021, la entidad logró atender a 4.000 menores más de los previstos, según su capacidad instalada.
Por otra parte, el servicio de API aumentó su capacidad en un 2,8%, pero tampoco consiguió llegar a su capacidad máxima, pasó de operar al 114% en 2021 a 82% en 2023.
Zonas más afectadas
Según el informe de la Contraloría, entre 2021 y 2023, la disminución de los servicios del programa Intramuros afectó a 78 cantones. El cantón Central de Puntarenas fue uno de los más impactados durante ese lapso porque sufrió una reducción del 46% en los cupos, lo cual equivale a 1.325 niños.
En el cantón de Pérez Zeledón, en San José, la disminución fue de 1.226 personas, lo que representa una caída del 45%. En Pococí, Limón, la reducción fue aún más pronunciada, con 1.184 personas menos atendidas, lo que equivale a una disminución en la cobertura del 60%.
Dentro de la Gran Área Metropolitana (GAM) también se observan descensos importantes. En el cantón Central de Cartago, la cantidad de beneficiarios disminuyó en 844 (reducción del 27%), en Desamparados bajó en 648 personas (48% menos) y en el cantón Central de Alajuela cayó en 577 personas (32% menos).
Disminuye entrega diarios y leche
Por otra parte, la auditoría revela que durante el periodo analizado un total de 34 cantones también experimentaron una baja en la cobertura de la estrategia Extramuros de los Cen-Cinái, la cual contempla la entrega de leche y alimentos diarios a familias que viven en condición de vulnerabilidad, pobreza y pobreza extrema.
A pesar de que la población atendida fuera de los establecimientos del Cen-Cinái se mantuvo relativamente estable en poco más de 125. 500 personas, la capacidad de atención se redujo en un 6,4%, afectando principalmente a regiones fuera de la GAM.
El informe destaca que los cantones más afectados por esta situación fueron Upala, Pococí, Golfito y Matina.
En Upala, la población atendida en 2023 se redujo en 1.000 personas atendidas con respecto al 2021 (una disminución del 22,7%). En tanto, en Pococí, Golfito y Matina los recortes fueron de 361, 222 y 218 beneficiarios, respectivamente, lo que equivale a caídas del 4,9%, 8% y 6,7%, durante ese periodo.
Dirección de Cen-Cinái opera sin planificación
Según el informe, después del 2021 la Dirección de Cen-Cinái dejó de contar con un instrumento de planificación que permita articular los niveles de gestión y los procesos institucionales, lo que desencadenó diversas afectaciones en los servicios, permitiendo que miles de menores quedaran fuera de la cobertura Intramuros y Extramuros.
Además, la Contraloría encontró que no se ha establecido un criterio claro para planificar la cobertura de los servicios en el corto y mediano plazo, especialmente en términos demográficos, de vulnerabilidad o financieros. Debido a esto, el 52% de las oficinas locales consultadas por la auditoría dijo no poseer un proceso definido para la planificación institucional.
“Las situaciones presentadas obedecen a que la Administración dejó de lado el direccionamiento estratégico de los servicios que presta, por lo que ha concentrado sus esfuerzos en la atención de requerimientos propios de la operación diaria sin que exista un fundamento en una proyección de las necesidades de la población objetivo”, indica el informe.
En cuanto a la apertura de nuevos centros, la auditoría destaca que la planificación se realiza de manera anual y sin una proyección plurianual, por lo que la falta de visión a largo plazo limita el desarrollo de los servicios. Para 2025, se tiene previsto abrir 12 nuevos centros, de los cuales solo dos corresponden a proyectos nuevos, mientras que los otros 10 son reaperturas de locales con órdenes sanitarias u otros problemas.
La distribución de los nuevos establecimientos también refleja una “concentración desigual”, pues cuatro de ellos estarían en la Región Brunca y dos en las regiones de Huetar Caribe, Chorotega, Central Sur, Central Este y Huetar Norte.

author: The Telegraph
title: Eleven police officers killed in Pakistan ambush
text:
Armed men ambushed a military convoy in eastern
Pakistan on Thursday, killing at least eleven police officers and injuring seven others.
Police officials told local media that two vans, carrying more than 20 officers, were trapped in rainwater when the “bandits” launched rockets at them.
The convoy came under attack in the Rahim Yar Khan district in a remote area when returning from routine duties aimed at targeting robbers in the region.
Maryam Nawaz, the Punjab chief minister, condemned the attack and vowed that it would not go “unavenged”.
She said that her team of officials was dispatched with “clear directions to sort them out decisively”.
“Sacrifices of police personnel will always be remembered,” she said, instructing the authorities to take immediate action to recover the missing officers.
Shehbaz Sharif, Pakistan’s prime minister, ordered “immediate and effective action” against those responsible for the attack. Asif Ali Zardari, the country’s president, also condemned it.
Neighbouring Sindh province chief minister Murad Ali Shah has offered support to treat the injured officers.
“Sindh, Punjab and Balochistan police should plan a joint operation against dacoits,” he said.
“Punjab police is as brave as Sindh police, both have always fought against terrorism and dacoits,” he added. The armed groups in the region have consistently posed challenges to the provincial governments of Sindh and Punjab, despite numerous operations aimed at eradicating them.
In April, a review committee of the National Action Plan decided to launch a joint operation by the police forces in the area.
Earlier in the day, gunmen opened fire on a school bus in the Attock district of the same region, killing two children, according to the police.
The attack on Thursday morning left five other children wounded as they were on their way to school. The children involved were as young as five years old.
Police reported that the assailants seemed to be targeting the driver, who was also injured.
Attock district is located near Pakistan’s volatile north west, an area where attacks by armed groups have surged in recent years.
In 2014, Pakistani Taliban gunmen attacked a military-run school in the region, killing nearly 150 children.
The post
Eleven police officers killed in Pakistan ambush appeared first on The Telegraph.

author: Andrew Knoll
title: Healthier Ducks roster regains some of its offensive firepower
text:
With a victory over the Stanley Cup champions in their rearview mirror, the Ducks prepared for Friday’s grudge match with the visiting Arizona Coyotes by continuing to integrate core players who returned from injury.
Each one made a remarkable imprint
in Wednesday’s 5-2 win against the Vegas Golden Knights. Jamie Drysdale scored his first goal in nearly two years. Mason McTavish recorded his first points in more than a month, three of them, all of which were primary assists. Trevor Zegras picked up an assist and generated a breakaway opportunity. That’s the sort of offensive pop that has been sorely lacking for a Ducks squad that has dropped 13 of its 21 losses in either one-goal games or games with a late empty-netter that extended the final deficit to two scores.
“When you lose those pieces, it’s obviously a big impact, especially when you’re losing games by one goal,” Ducks coach Greg Cronin said.
Cronin said he was encouraged by McTavish’s production as well as his performance in puck battles, though he is still getting his legs back under him after missing about three weeks. Zegras had an even longer layoff and Drysdale’s felt interminable, with two games played interrupting a string of more than 100 missed. All three players were taken as lottery picks in successive drafts between 2019 and 2021, with Zegras being the elder statesman among them at 22.
Per Cronin, Drysdale’s impact on breakouts as well as in turning those zone exits into promising offense and sound forechecking was already readily apparent. Cronin, who coached in Colorado’s system, said that while he wouldn’t elevate Drysdale eye to eye with the Avalanche’s Norris Trophy winner Cale Makar, he did consider Drysdale to be similar in that he could “break a forecheck” as a one-man gang.
“Drysdale’s impact is huge. His ability to break pucks out, his ability to generate offense through the neutral zone – whether he’s passing or skating – his ability to be an offensive threat with and without the puck,” Cronin said. “He does it all real fluidly; it adds more potency to our whole group when he’s on the ice.”
Cronin said he felt McTavish was already a solid second-line center with the potential to be a No. 1 pivot in time. He said his staff was “promoting that smash-mouth game” with McTavish. While Zegras, who has played a bit of wing this season when both McTavish and the Ducks’ most recent lotto selection, Leo Carlsson, were available as well, might never be considered rough-and-tumble, Cronin said one of the NHL’s most creative offensive players has clear incentive to improve his game on the other side of the puck.
“The more he gets committed to defense, the more his offense is going to grow,” Cronin said.
Next up, that trio will face the Arizona Coyotes for the third and final time this season. They defeated Arizona, 4-3, in overtime back on Nov. 1 at Honda Center
behind a hat trick from Troy Terry, who also scored Wednesday. They lost a prior meeting, 2-1, in the desert back on Oct. 21, with their lone goal produced by another of Wednesday’s scorers, Frank Vatrano.
Heading into the holiday break, Arizona had its four-game winning streak snapped by the Avalanche. They returned the favor, winning, 5-4, in overtime on Wednesday to halt Colorado’s modest surge at two games. Clayton Keller paces the Coyotes in scoring and Lawson Crouse, who struck twice in that 4-3 loss to the Ducks in November, leads them in goals.
On the injury front for the Ducks, Carlsson (knee) remains out with four-to-six weeks being his timeline for return. Veteran defenseman Radko Gudas (lower body) was also injured in that match. He remains day-to-day and should be considered doubtful for Friday.
COYOTES AT DUCKS
When: Friday, 7 p.m.
Where: Honda Center
TV: Bally Sports West

author: Carlos Vielma
title: En Yaracuy productores de café reciben semillas y bioinsumos
text:
Productores cafetaleros de la microcuenca en la zona alta de la parroquia Campo Elías, municipio Bruzual del estado Yaracuy, este jueves recibieron lotes de semillas de café y bioinsumos para generar las plántulas que sembrarán en el próximo ciclo de cultivo.
La Alcaldía de Bruzual atendió a una veintena de microproductores de la zona con la dotación de los materiales que necesitan para sembrar café en sus lotes de tierra, como parte del plan de asistencia técnica a la producción agropecuaria que el Gobierno bolivariano desarrolla en distintas áreas y rubros que se producen en el municipio.
El alcalde de la jurisdicción, Carlos González, informó que el proyecto integral inicia con la siembra de las semillas en los viveros, para luego obtener las plantas que serán sembradas en la zona de la microcuenca, ubicada en el sector de la Quebrada del Chorro.
También se tiene previsto entregar los insumos en otros cantones agrícolas constituidos por cooperativas y unidades de producción familiares ubicados en distintos puntos del municipio.
“Cada productor recibe las semillas de café y los bioinsumos con el objetivo de que se sumen al trabajo agroecológico y así generen los ingresos que necesitan para sus hogares y contribuyan con el fortalecimiento de la producción y la economía local”, mencionó el mandatario municipal.
Asistencia integral
González destacó que con el plan integral de siembra de café se brinda asistencia técnica especializada y seguimiento en el proceso del cultivo.
“En cada uno de los sectores intervenidos, se capacitan a los productores con apoyo de los equipos técnicos de la alcaldía y de productores más experimentados”, indicó.
Refirió que los cafetaleros se forman en la construcción de generadores, preparación y elaboración de viveros cafetal, control de plagas y enfermedades, y elaboración de fertilizantes orgánicos y su aplicación, para atender sus cultivos de manera apropiada y sacarles el máximo provecho.
Igualmente, subrayó que los bioinsumos se obtienen a partir del procesamiento de materia vegetal, por lo que son libres de agentes químicos que puedan afectar la calidad del café, además que son totalmente amigables con el medio ambiente.
Se trata de productos que mejoran la eficiencia y la disponibilidad de los nutrientes en las plantas y se liberan de manera controlada, lo cual evita su pérdida y no afecta de ningún modo al entorno natural.
Al respecto, agregó que este proyecto contribuye a posicionar y consolidar el sector productivo del municipio, con cultivos nuevos que permitan la renovación de la superficie cafetalera y, de esta forma, contribuir con el incremento de la producción regional y nacional.
Asimismo, detalló que el plan incluye el seguimiento y asistencia técnico de los cultivos, desde la generación de las plántulas y el florecimiento de las bayas y correspondientes granos de café hasta su cosecha y procesamiento final.
“Nuestros productores cuentan con el total apoyo del Gobierno revolucionario para el desarrollo exitoso de sus siembras de café. Vamos a fortalecer el rubro para que juntos convirtamos poco a poco a Bruzual en una potencia cafetalera, que esté a la altura de las
mejores zonas productoras de la región. Ese es el plan”, afirmó el alcalde.

author: Michelle Devani
title: Ways To Make Your Best Friends Feel Better When They're Down
text:
Life happens. Which means that bad things happen almost every time. When a circle of negativity is making you stuck in your life, it is usually hard to go out for that circle. This will lead that person to make self destructive choices. What if your best friend is going through one of these phases? How can you help?
Best friends usually share feelings together and that includes feeling of pain and sadness. That is why you need to help your best friend to get out of the negative head-space and back to her/his life. There are some fool proof ways to make your best friend feel better. Here they are:
Contents
1. Let Them Cry It is not a good thing for negative feelings to be held inside. It will build up and suffocate us which will make us more miserable for a long time. So you need to let your best friend cry on your shoulder to let it all out.
2. Listen To Them A person to talk to about their burden will soothe them the most. So really listen to them without trying to reply or make judgements. Simply listening to them works the best.
3. Get Into A Creative Activity Another way to get the negativity out of your best friend’s body is by doing something creative. You can write, sing, make messy drawings, anything. This will make them process their feelings better by making something tangible.
4. Distract Them Try to distract their mind from the negativity by doing something you know they will like.You can take them to the movie or cook something with them. This is a quick and easy ways to make your best friend feel better.
5. Validate Their Feelings People often feel guilty or confused about the feelings they are experiencing which makes them stuck in that position longer. Remind them to just feel what is felt now and to let go of the grip to make things to flow faster.
6. Make Them Laugh Since you are his/her best friend, you share the same humor together. So why not try to make her laugh? Laughing is said to be the best cure to sadness.
7. Tell Them That You Are There For Them Being in the negative headspace can feel lonely and your best friend will feel like a burden so he/she will not reach out to you. You should calm them by saying that you are always there for them, because that is what best friends do. This is a great Send These Comforting Messages for A Friend Who Is Sad .
8. Take Them Outside Being outside in a good weather is proven to increase a person’s well being. Because your best friend is sad, he/ she will want to stay home to be continually sad. Don’t let them do that by taking them outside for a fun activity.
9. Remind Them Of Who They Are To be able to be back to a happy state, they need to find strength. More often than not, the strength is already within them. So, remind them of the positive things that is within them to lift their spirits back up.
10. Offer Help Offering help is the best ways to make your best friend feel better. Sometimes, things can feel unbearable when in a negative mindset. By doing this you are making their burden lighter and making them feel happier.
11. Send Them Positive Quotes This is a quick way to make someone a bit happier. Send them positive quotes that you find in the internet for them to read and contemplate on. Doing this will convey the message that you are thoughtful and they will feel that you care for them.
12. Bring Them Gifts Little thoughtful gifts will always make someone way happier. These gifts can be little positive letters, their favorite snack, a handpicked self care starter pack and more.
Also read: Creative Birthday Gift Ideas for Your Best Friend
13. Be There With Them The presence of someone we love can actually make us happier. So what you need to do is simply being there to assist her/him and his/ her day will be better.
14. Hug Your Best Friend A long, tight hug is proven to be a great way to boost someone’s mood. It will lower down the heart rate which causes them to be more relaxed. So hug them for a long time until they are better. This is a great Things to Say to Help Someone Who Is Stressed Out .
More Tips On Ways To Cheer Your Best Friends 1. Do Not Try To Solve The Problem The worst thing you can do is actually trying to solve the problem. This makes you seem judgmental.
2. Do A Self Care Routine Self care routine can be an at home spa day or a movie marathon. As long as it makes your best friend happy.
3. Sweat It Out Exercising boost endorphin into your system and make us happier. Be your best friend’s workout buddy to make them happier.
4. Have Adventures Have little adventures to a small city or even just circling the block. Doing this will make it fun and interesting.
Signs That Your Best Friend Is Happier 1. They Do Not Say Negative Things They do not whine about the problem or say bad things about themselves. Negativity is out of their vocabulary.
2. They Initiate New Activities Together When they have the strength to make new, exciting plans in the future, it means that your best friend is back on their feet.
3. They Move On They simply move on from the problem they were facing and doesn’t struggle with it anymore.
4. They Have New Lessons From the experience, they actually take out one or two lessons which means that your best friend have healed from the traumatic event,
Seeing your best friend in a tough space will be an unpleasant time. That is why you need to do everything you can to make it better. Do the ways to make your best friend feel better and your best friend will start showing the signs that they are happier.
Also read: Ways to Become a Great Friend

author: George Marston
title: Duke #2 brings another classic GI Joe character into the mix | GamesRadar+
text: Skybound's [current Duke limited series](https://www.gamesradar.com/duke-is-a-surprising-reinvention-of-gi-joe-for-the-new-energon-universe/) from writer Joshua Williamson, artist Tom Reilly, and colorist Jordie Bellaire kicked the GI Joe portion of the publisher's new [Energon Universe](https://www.gamesradar.com/robert-kirkman-explains-that-jaw-dropping-void-rivals-twist-and-how-he-established-a-new-shared-universe/) line off with a bang, setting the stage for several more GI Joe spin-off titles to come. With Duke #2 due out on January 31, Skybound has now released an early preview of pages from the upcoming issue, in which Duke comes face-to-face with another classic GI Joe character, Clutch. Along with the preview of interior pages, Skybound has also release covers for Duke #2 by Tom Reilly, Ricardo Lopez Ortiz, Tyler Boss and Jason Wordie, Aco, and Nick Dragotta. Check out the pages and covers in the gallery below: "Codename: GI JOE continues! Conrad Hauser, AKA Duke, is on the run from the very government he trusted, investigating secrets that may be More Than Meets The Eye," reads Skybound's official solicitation text for Duke #2. "Now, he’s about to meet the last person any GI Joe fan ever expected! Are they friend, foe, or in it for themselves?" Duke is the first of four limited series that will launch the GI Joe side of the Energon Universe, with writer Joshua Williamson, artist Andrea Milana, and colorist Annalisa Leoni's Cobra Commander #1 marking the launch of the line's second title on January 17. The other side of Skybound's Energon Universe is of course the [Transformers ](https://www.gamesradar.com/daniel-warren-johnsons-transformers-is-a-thrilling-fresh-start-for-the-robots-in-disguise/)line, which debuted as part of Skybound Entertainment alongside GI Joe in the comic Void Rivals #1 as a surprise to readers. Check out the [best non-Marvel/DC superhero universes](https://www.gamesradar.com/best-non-marvel-dc-superhero-universes/).

author: @@senego
title: Cheikh Abdoul Gainde Fatma: « Un pilier vient de nous quitter »
text:
Le rappel à Dieu de Serigne Moustapha Saliou Mbacké est une grande perte pour la Oumma islamique et la communauté mouride. Fils du cinquième khalife général des mourides, il était reconnu pour son immense savoir, sa piété et son engagement spirituel.
Respecté et écouté, Serigne Moustapha Saliou Moustapha incarnait une droiture incommensurable, guidant les fidèles avec sagesse et humilité. Son décès laisse un vide immense au sein de la confrérie mouride et bien au-delà. Serigne Abdoul Gaindé Fatma pleure un grand érudit.
Le post!
« Un pilier vient de nous quitter. Une personnalité d’une dimension exceptionnelle. Grand érudit au savoir encyclopédique et insondable, Serigne Moustapha vouait un amour inégalable à Cheikhoul Khadim. Il était le défenseur infatigable tant craint et redouté par les ennemis de l’Islam . C’est une lourde perte pour toute la communauté.
إنا لله وإنا إليه راجعون.
Tiis dileen yëgal waccug liggéeyu sëriñ Mustafaa Mbàkke saaliwu .
Yàlla nako suñu boroom yëram.
Kénou gu rëy danu na. Gëm Serigne Touba, beugko, khamko, mu jaralko luné. Ku Baakh té tedd dëdouna. »
Que son âme repose en paix, et que son héritage spirituel continue d’inspirer les générations à venir.

author: EIN News
title: Growing Incidence of Chronic Diseases is Driving the Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market; says TNR - Beverage Industry Today - EIN Presswire
text:
Growing Incidence of Chronic Diseases is Driving the Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market; says TNR
Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market is Anticipated to Reach USD 17.3 Bn by 2031, at a CAGR of 6% (2023 - 2031)
WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, UNITED STATES, December 28, 2023 / EINPresswire.com / -- Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market Introduction
The global oral clinical nutritional supplement market has witnessed substantial growth and evolution in recent years, driven by a convergence of factors that highlight the increasing importance of targeted nutritional support in healthcare. These supplements, available in various formulations and tailored to address specific health conditions or deficiencies, play a pivotal role in meeting the diverse dietary needs of individuals globally. Stringent regulations governing their production, labeling, and distribution ensure that consumers receive products that meet high-quality standards, further bolstering trust and demand in the market.
Get Sample Copy of the Report
Understanding Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement
Oral clinical nutritional supplements are specialized products designed to provide targeted nutrients in a convenient form for individuals who may have difficulty meeting their dietary requirements through regular food intake alone. These supplements come in various forms such as liquids, powders, capsules, or gels and are formulated to address specific nutritional needs or health conditions. These supplements are formulated to support various health conditions or deficiencies. For instance, there are formulations specifically designed for elderly individuals to support bone health or cognitive function, while others might focus on aiding digestion or managing metabolic disorders.
Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market Key Highlights
In 2022, oral clinical nutritional supplements were highly prescribed for malnutrition. In 2022, it was predicted that 149 million children under the age of five were stunted (too short for their age), 45 million were wasted (too thin for their height), and 37 million were overweight or obese. Thus to overcome these health issues oral clinical nutritional supplements play a crucial role in managing malnutrition by providing concentrated and readily available nutrients to individuals.
Speak to our analyst in case of queries before buying this report
The aging population across many regions has also significantly contributed to the expansion of this market. With advancing age comes an increased need for specialized nutritional support to address age-related health concerns. For instance, according to a research, the number of individuals aged 60 and more in Asia is predicted to more than quadruple, from 535 million in 2015 to 1.3 billion in 2050. With around 4.7 billion people living in Asia - almost 60% of the world's total - the worldwide trend towards an ageing population is projected to have a substantial influence. Malnutrition is more frequent in elderly individuals, and with one-fifth of the Asian population expected to be over the age of 80 by 2050, the issue is projected to become a significant burden on the healthcare system in the future years.
North America had the highest share in the oral clinical nutritional supplement market in 2022. North America especially United States has a relatively high prevalence of chronic diseases such as obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, and gastrointestinal disorders. Thus oral clinical nutritional supplements play a crucial role in managing these conditions and aiding in recovery, contributing to their widespread use.
Key Developments in the Global Oral Clinical Nutritional Supplement Market
In December 2023, Roche has announced a formal merger agreement to acquire Carmot Therapeutics, Inc., which has a research and development portfolio that includes clinical stage subcutaneous and oral incretins for the treatment of obese individuals with and without diabetes.

author: yours friend
title: Petition · WE WANT OUR MONEY BACK · Change.org
text:
We are members of the JFAN Ministries, founded by Bishop Octavio Nevis, who recommended that we invest in Nevis Trading & Investment Consultants Pvt. Ltd. He assured us that the company's promoters were highly reputable in the market, promising a secure investment with a 5% monthly interest return. It was represented as a completely safe venture, assuring a prompt return of both the interest and the capital within a month.
After investing with Mr. Joshua Nevis, the promoter of the company, it has now been two years, and we have yet to receive either the promised interest or our initial capital. Many individuals financed their investments through loans or by selling their homes, and people are now facing severe financial hardship. Despite repeated assurances and promised dates from Mr. Joshua Nevis, nothing has materialized. Unfortunately, Bishop Octavio Nevis has distanced himself from this matter, leaving the affected individuals in dire straits.
This situation has led to a significant negative impact on our community, with some members even facing homelessness. We urge everyone affected by this matter to join forces, sign this petition, and collectively raise our voices to address and rectify this issue. Let us unite in solidarity to bring attention to this matter and seek a resolution for the well-being of all affected individuals.

organizations.name: nevis trading & investment consultants pvt. ltd
